ground_truth: Nathan is leafing through the lingerie ads in the newspaper, muttering, when Florence enters. As Nathan gets into the driver's seat, he hands her the infant and then a copy of Dr. Spock's Baby and Child Care. Hi nods as he pulls away from the curb, and Ed suddenly bursts out crying. The lights are thrown on, revealing a room hung with streamers. Ed enters with Nathan Jr., and he reaches for the child, takes the baby in both hands, and holds him out at arm's length, pointing him at various places of interest. The baby looks goggle-eyed at each one. Impatient with the nonsense, he props Nathan Jr. up in the corner of the couch, while Hi sits at the other corner and Ed sits in a facing chair. Hi beams at Nathan Jr., Ed smiles at him, and Nathan Jr. looks from one to the other, deadpan, as they seem to be waiting for him to contribute to the conversation. Suddenly, Hi slaps his knee as Ed gets up, picks up the baby, and he frantically reaches for a Polaroid camera. She sits down on the couch with Nathan Jr. as Hi starts screwing the camera into a tripod, adjusting absently, peering through the lens, and as she complies, Hi sits on the couch, holding the camera's cable release. He puts his arm around Ed and smiles at the offscreen camera, while Ed nestles her head against Hi's shoulder, talking through his teeth as he continues to grin at the camera. Meanwhile, two men are trotting out to a Mercury that sits untended at a gas island with a gas hose on automatic stuck in its tank. As Gale starts up the car, Evelle yanks the hose out and drops it to the ground, with Gale already starting to peel out as Evelle gets in. Hi sits asleep on the sofa at the far end of the room, in a pool of lamp light. By the time the camera tightens on his face, the knocking has become quite loud, and he looks up, alarmed, at the front door of the trailer, where someone is pounding insistently. He sits up and tenses, looks around, squinting at Hi as she hisses. As Ed turns back to the bedroom and enters, shutting the door, she listens hard at the door to Hi's footsteps crossing the living room, the click of the door opening, followed by silence, and then a burst of raucous male laughter as Gale roars with laughter. Ed smiles politely and then squints at Hi, while Gale admires the baby, and Hi and Ed look at each other uncomfortably. Hi clears his throat while Gale stares at the streamers and decorations, reading aloud, as Hi and Ed respond simultaneously.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Nathan is flipping through lingerie ads in the newspaper and muttering when Florence enters. As Nathan gets into the driver's seat, he hands her an infant and Dr. Spock's Baby and Child Care. Hi nods while pulling away from the curb, and Ed bursts into tears. The lights reveal a room with streamers. Ed enters with Nathan Jr., reaching for and holding the baby at arm's length, pointing him at various places. The baby looks wide-eyed. Impatient, he props Nathan Jr. up on the couch; Hi sits at the other end, Ed in a chair. Hi beams at Nathan Jr., Ed smiles, and Nathan Jr. looks at them both, expressionless. Suddenly, Hi slaps his knee as Ed picks up the baby and reaches for a Polaroid camera. She sits with Nathan Jr. as Hi screws the camera onto a tripod, adjusting it and peering through the lens. Hi sits, arm around Ed, smiling at the offscreen camera as she rests her head on Hi's shoulder, talking through grinning teeth. Meanwhile, two men run to a Mercury at a gas station, with a hose on automatic. As Gale starts the car, Evelle pulls out the hose and drops it, Gale peeling out as Evelle hops in. Hi sleeps on the sofa in lamp light. As the camera zooms in on his face, knocking becomes loud, and he looks alarmed at the trailer's front door, where someone knocks insistently. He sits up, tenses, and looks around, squinting at Hi as she hisses. Ed turns to the bedroom and listens to Hi's footsteps in the living room, the door opening, silence, and raucous male laughter from Gale. Ed smiles politely, squints at Hi while Gale admires the baby, and Hi and Ed exchange uncomfortable glances. Hi clears his throat as Gale reads the streamers aloud, and Hi and Ed respond at once.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Nathan mutters while leafing through lingerie ads as Florence enters. Nathan hands her the infant and Dr. Spock's Baby and Child Care in the car. As he drives, Ed cries. Suddenly, the room lights up with streamers. Ed and Hi sit with Nathan Jr., waiting for him to interact. Hi prepares a Polaroid as Ed sits with the baby. Meanwhile, two men drive a Mercury from a gas station, hose dangling. Hi sleeps on the sofa, alarmed by loud knocking. Ed listens as Hi opens the door, followed by raucous laughter. Gale admires the baby, causing Hi and Ed discomfort. Gale reads decorations aloud, with Hi and Ed responding simultaneously.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: Nathan is flipping through the various lingerie advertisements in the newspaper, muttering under his breath, when Florence makes her entrance into the room. Once Nathan settles himself comfortably into the driver’s seat of the car, he carefully hands over the infant to her, along with a copy of Dr. Spock's Baby and Child Care. Acknowledging her presence with a nod, he smoothly pulls away from the curb, and almost immediately, Ed suddenly bursts into tears. The lights are dramatically switched on, illuminating a room adorned with colorful streamers. Ed makes her entrance holding Nathan Jr., and Nathan instinctively reaches out for the child, taking the baby firmly in both hands and holding him out at arm's length, directing the child’s attention toward various points of interest in the room. The baby, with wide, goggle-eyed wonder, takes in each sight. Growing impatient with the frivolous display, he decides to prop Nathan Jr. up in the cozy corner of the couch. Meanwhile, Hi positions himself at the opposite end, while Ed comfortably settles into a chair facing them. Hi radiates with beaming admiration at Nathan Jr., Ed offers a warm smile toward him, and Nathan Jr. looks back and forth between the two, maintaining a deadpan expression, as if they are all waiting in anticipation for him to join in or add to the conversation. Out of the blue, Hi slaps his knee in sudden realization, just as Ed stands, picks up the baby, and anxiously reaches for a Polaroid camera. She then settles back down onto the couch with Nathan Jr. in her arms as Hi begins the task of securing the camera onto a tripod, adjusting it absentmindedly, peering meticulously through the lens. Following her cue, Hi sits beside her on the couch, clutching the camera's cable release. He affectionately puts his arm around Ed, grinning broadly at the offscreen camera, while Ed nestles her head against Hi's shoulder, continuing to talk through his teeth as he maintains his smile. Meanwhile, two men are briskly trotting out toward a Mercury that sits unattended at a gas island with a gas hose running on automatic, inserted into its tank. As Gale starts up the car with urgency, Evelle hastily yanks the hose out, carelessly dropping it onto the ground, with Gale already beginning to screech out of the lot as Evelle climbs in. Hi is now seen fast asleep on the sofa, positioned at the far end of the room, illuminated by a pool of lamplight. As the camera gradually zooms in on his face, the persistent knocking has grown considerably loud, causing him to look up with alarm toward the front door of the trailer, where someone is pounding insistently. He sits up, tenses visibly, and glances around, squinting at Hi as she quietly hisses. As Ed turns decisively back to the bedroom, enters, and shuts the door, she listens intently at the door to the sound of Hi's footsteps crossing the living room, the distinct click of the door opening, followed by an eerie silence, and then a sudden eruption of raucous male laughter as Gale bursts out roaring with laughter. Ed smiles politely in response and then squints at Hi, while Gale admires the baby, and Hi and Ed exchange uncomfortable glances. Hi self-consciously clears his throat while Gale intently stares at the streamers and festive decorations, reading aloud, as Hi and Ed respond in unison.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
Nathan is meticulously flipping through an array of lingerie advertisements that are strategically placed throughout the newspaper. As he does so, he mutters under his breath, perhaps out of habit or mild irritation. This is the exact moment when Florence makes her grand entrance into the room, changing the atmosphere instantly. Once Nathan has situated himself comfortably and securely in the driver's seat of the car, he makes a point of carefully handing over the precious infant to her. Along with the baby, he also provides her with a copy of Dr. Spock's renowned book, "Baby and Child Care," as if offering wisdom for the journey ahead. Acknowledging her with a respectful nod, Nathan smoothly maneuvers the vehicle away from the curb. However, almost immediately after this fluid motion, Ed suddenly and unexpectedly bursts into tears, shattering the momentary calm.

The lights in the room are then dramatically turned on, casting a bright glow that reveals a space richly adorned with vibrant and colorful streamers hanging from every corner. At this moment, Ed makes her entrance, holding Nathan Jr. As if by instinct, Nathan reaches out, taking the baby securely in both hands and holding him out at arm's length. He aims to guide the child's attention toward various intriguing points of interest scattered around the room. The infant, filled with wide-eyed wonder, takes in each and every sight with an expression of amazement.

Growing somewhat impatient with this seemingly frivolous display, Nathan decides to position Nathan Jr. comfortably in a cozy corner of the couch. Meanwhile, Hi strategically positions himself at the opposite end of the couch, while Ed sits comfortably in a chair facing them both. Hi's face beams with admiration as he gazes at Nathan Jr., and Ed responds with a warm smile, looking toward Hi. Meanwhile, Nathan Jr. shifts his gaze back and forth between the two, maintaining a deadpan expression, as though considering whether or not to join in their unspoken conversation.

Out of the blue, Hi suddenly slaps his knee in a moment of realization. At the same time, Ed stands up, gently picks up the baby, and reaches for a Polaroid camera with a sense of urgency. Once again seated on the couch with Nathan Jr. in her arms, Hi takes on the task of attaching the camera onto a tripod. He goes about adjusting it, seemingly absentmindedly, while he peers meticulously through the lens. Following Ed's cue, Hi sits beside her on the couch, tightly gripping the camera's cable release. He affectionately places his arm around Ed and grins broadly toward the offscreen camera. Ed nestles her head affectionately against Hi's shoulder while continuing to talk through his teeth, maintaining his smile.

Meanwhile, in a completely different setting, two men are seen briskly trotting toward a Mercury that sits unattended at a gas island, with a gas hose running automatically into its tank. With urgency, Gale starts up the car, while Evelle hastily yanks the hose out, letting it drop carelessly onto the ground. Gale has already begun to screech out of the lot as Evelle manages to climb in.

Hi is then shown fast asleep on the sofa, positioned at the far end of the room, enveloped in a pool of soft lamplight. As the camera gradually zooms in on his face, the sound of persistent knocking grows considerably louder. This prompts Hi to look up with alarm, directing his attention toward the front door of the trailer, where someone is pounding insistently. He sits up, visibly tense, and scans the room as Ed discreetly hisses at him. Ed then decisively turns back toward the bedroom, enters, and quietly shuts the door behind her. She listens intently to the sound of Hi's footsteps crossing the living room, the distinct click of the door opening, followed by an eerie silence, and then a sudden outburst of raucous male laughter as Gale erupts with laughter.

Ed smiles politely in response and then squints at Hi, while Gale admires the baby, casting appreciative glances. Meanwhile, Hi and Ed exchange uneasy glances. Hi self-consciously clears his throat, aware of the attention, while Gale fixates on the streamers and festive decorations, reading aloud as Hi and Ed respond in unison.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Nathan is sitting down with a newspaper open to the lingerie ads, slowly leafing through the pages while softly muttering to himself. At this moment, Florence enters the room, causing Nathan to pause momentarily. Transitioning to the car, Nathan situates himself into the driver's seat, reaches over to hand Florence the infant carefully, ensuring she's got a good hold, and promptly follows with a copy of Dr. Spock's Baby and Child Care, placing it into her grasp as well. Once settled, he gives her a small nod, signaling readiness, and starts the car to pull away smoothly from the curb. Suddenly, Ed bursts into tears, the sound filling the space abruptly. The scene shifts indoors where the lights flood into brightness, revealing a room festively decorated with streamers hanging from above. Ed makes an entrance holding Nathan Jr., moving toward Nathan, who instinctively extends his arms to take the baby securely into both hands, holding him out at arm's length. He gently points the baby toward various interesting spots around the room, causing Nathan Jr. to look wide-eyed at each new sight. Growing impatient with Nathan's antics, Ed resigns to prop Nathan Jr. up snugly in the couch corner, with Hi positioning himself comfortably at the opposite corner, while Ed takes a seat across from them in a chair. Hi beams proudly at Nathan Jr., and Ed offers a warm smile, together expectantly gazing at the baby, who merely glances back, expressionless, seemingly pondering what to add to the silent conversation. Out of nowhere, Hi slaps his knee animatedly as Ed rises from her seat, scooping up the baby swiftly, and instinctively reaches for a Polaroid camera. She returns to the couch with Nathan Jr. in tow as Hi busies himself screwing the camera into a tripod, making adjustments absentmindedly while peering through the lens to get the right focus. Once ready, Hi joins Ed on the couch, taking hold of the cable release for the camera. He wraps an arm lovingly around Ed, grinning widely at the camera offscreen, while Ed leans her head softly against Hi's shoulder, speaking through a fixed grin. Concurrently, two men are hastily making their way over to a Mercury vehicle, left unattended at a gas station island, with a gas hose connected to its tank set on automatic. As Gale cranks up the engine, Evelle quickly pulls the hose out, letting it fall to the ground, just as Gale begins to drive away, with Evelle climbing into the moving car. Meanwhile, inside the trailer, Hi is found asleep on the sofa, awash in the soft light emanating from a nearby lamp. As the camera focuses more closely on his sleeping face, the sound of knocking progressively grows louder, jarring Hi awake and leaving him staring with alarm toward the front door where the pounding persists. Sitting up, Hi grows tense, eyes darting around the room nervously, his squint directed at Ed as she hisses quietly at him. Ed turns her back and heads to the bedroom, entering and shutting the door softly behind her, pressing her ear against it to listen intently. She hears Hi's footsteps crossing the living room, followed by the click of the door opening, leading to a brief silence, broken by the sudden eruption of boisterous male laughter as Gale guffaws loudly. Ed maintains a polite smile and narrows her eyes at Hi, who is now holding the baby under Gale's admiring gaze. Hi and Ed exchange uncomfortable glances, the tension palpable. Hi clears his throat awkwardly while Gale's attention shifts to the room's decorative streamers and festive themes, reading aloud what he sees, prompting a synchronized response from both Hi and Ed.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Nathan mutters while leafing through lingerie ads in the newspaper as Florence enters. He hands her the infant and a copy of Dr. Spock's Baby and Child Care before driving away, acknowledging Ed's sudden crying. The scene changes to a room lit with streamers, where Ed enters with Nathan Jr. and interacts with the child by pointing him at various places. Growing impatient, he props Nathan Jr. on the couch's corner while Hi, beaming, and Ed, smiling, sit nearby, awaiting the child's reaction. Hi suddenly slaps his knee as Ed retrieves Nathan Jr. and Hi prepares a Polaroid camera, setting it up on a tripod. Ed settles with the baby on the couch while Hi manipulates the camera's controls, eventually joining Ed for a posed photo. Meanwhile, two men hastily leave a gas station, Evelle discarding the gas hose as Gale speeds off. Later, Hi is asleep on a sofa under lamplight, startled awake by insistent knocking at the door. As he moves to answer it, Ed quietly listens from the bedroom, hearing the scene's silence break with male laughter from Gale. Ed exchanges polite looks with Hi as Gale admires the baby, and Hi and Ed share an uncomfortable glance. Gale comments on the streamers, reading aloud, prompting Hi and Ed's simultaneous response.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Nathan is leafing through the lingerie ads in the newspaper, muttering, when Florence enters. The newspaper, a local daily known for its wide reach, often features ads from popular department stores. As Nathan gets into the driver's seat of their well-used family sedan, he hands her the infant and then a copy of Dr. Spock's Baby and Child Care, a classic guide first published in 1946 that has helped millions of parents. Hi nods as he pulls away from the curb, and Ed suddenly bursts out crying, a reaction often studied in infant psychology. The lights in the living room are thrown on, revealing a room hung with streamers, typically used for celebrations or small gatherings. Ed enters with Nathan Jr., and he reaches for the child, takes the baby in both hands, and holds him out at arm's length, pointing him at various places of interest such as the family photo wall and the vintage clock on the mantle. The baby looks goggle-eyed at each one. Impatient with the nonsense, he props Nathan Jr. up in the corner of the couch, an old but comfortable piece of furniture, while Hi sits at the other corner and Ed sits in a facing chair. Hi beams at Nathan Jr., Ed smiles at him, and Nathan Jr. looks from one to the other, deadpan, as they seem to be waiting for him to contribute to the conversation that adults humorously attribute to babies. Suddenly, Hi slaps his knee as Ed gets up, picks up the baby, and he frantically reaches for a Polaroid camera, a popular instant camera brand introduced in the late 1940s. She sits down on the couch with Nathan Jr. as Hi starts screwing the camera into a tripod, adjusting absently, peering through the lens, and as she complies, Hi sits on the couch, holding the camera's cable release, a tool for remote photography. He puts his arm around Ed and smiles at the offscreen camera, while Ed nestles her head against Hi's shoulder, talking through his teeth as he continues to grin at the camera. Meanwhile, two men are trotting out to a Mercury, a classic American car brand, that sits untended at a gas island with a gas hose on automatic stuck in its tank. As Gale starts up the car, Evelle yanks the hose out and drops it to the ground, with Gale already starting to peel out as Evelle gets in. Hi sits asleep on the sofa at the far end of the room, in a pool of lamp light from a brass table lamp. By the time the camera tightens on his face, the knocking has become quite loud, and he looks up, alarmed, at the front door of the trailer, a typical mobile home setup, where someone is pounding insistently. He sits up and tenses, looks around, squinting at Hi as she hisses. As Ed turns back to the bedroom and enters, shutting the door, she listens hard at the door to Hi's footsteps crossing the living room, the click of the door opening, followed by silence, and then a burst of raucous male laughter as Gale roars with laughter, his boisterous nature well-known among friends. Ed smiles politely and then squints at Hi, while Gale admires the baby, and Hi and Ed look at each other uncomfortably. Hi clears his throat while Gale stares at the streamers and decorations, reading aloud, as Hi and Ed respond simultaneously, their voices reflecting their shared long-standing rhythm in conversation.

During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. He puts his arm around Ed and smiles at the offscreen camera while Ed nestles her head against Hi's shoulder talking through his teeth as he continues to grin at the camera. Meanwhile two men are trotting out to a Mercury that sits untended at a gas island with a gas hose on automatic stuck in its tank. As Gale starts up the car Evelle yanks the hose out and drops it to the ground with Gale already starting to peel out. as Evelle gets in. Hi sits asleep on the sofa at the far end of the room in a pool of lamp light. By the time the camera tightens on his face the knocking has become quite loud and he looks up alarmed at the front door of the trailer where someone is pounding insistently. He sits up and tenses looks around squinting at Hi as she hisses. As Ed turns back to the bedroom and enters shutting the door she listens hard at the door to Hi's footsteps crossing the living room. the click of the door opening followed by silence and then a burst of raucous male laughter. as Gale roars with laughter Ed smiles politely and then squints at Hi while Gale admires the baby and Hi and Ed look at each other uncomfortably. Hi clears his throat while Gale stares at the streamers and decorations reading aloud as Hi and Ed respond simultaneously.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Miriam is sketching the basketball plays in the calendar, humming, when Leonard dances in. As Miriam leaps into the pilot's chair, she tosses him the hamster and then a copy of Tolstoy's War and Peace. She winks as she propels away from the cliff, and Sam suddenly bursts out laughing. The curtains are pulled back, revealing a stage adorned with balloons. Sam arrives with Leonard Jr., and she reaches for the kitten, cradles the animal in both hands, and swings it around at arm's length, gesturing it at various landmarks. The kitten gazes wide-eyed at each one. Annoyed with the antics, she balances Leonard Jr. on the edge of the bookshelf, while Miriam reclines at the other edge and Sam perches in an adjacent tree. Miriam grins at Leonard Jr., Sam chuckles at her, and Leonard Jr. glances from one to the other, stone-faced, as they seem to be waiting for her to join the debate. Abruptly, Miriam claps her forehead as Sam stands up, grabs the kitten, and she eagerly lunges for a typewriter. He settles onto the bookshelf with Leonard Jr. as Miriam begins fastening the typewriter into a carrier, winding persistently, blinking through the ribbon, and as he obliges, Miriam lounges on the bookshelf, clutching the typewriter’s power cord. She wraps her hand around Sam and laughs at the unseen typewriter, while Sam rests her elbow against Miriam's knee, chatting through her fingertips as she keeps smirking at the typewriter. Meanwhile, two penguins are waddling out to a sailboat that bobs unattended at a dock with a winch on automatic dangling from its mast. As Lester revs up the ship, Oliver tugs the winch off and crashes it to the deck, with Lester already beginning to sail away as Oliver climbs in. Miriam reclines snoozing on the hammock at the distant part of the garden, in a halo of sunlight. By the time the typewriter zooms in on her face, the knocking has become quite soft, and she glances up, startled, at the tree gate of the cabin, where someone is thudding persistently. She stands up and freezes, glances around, squinting at Miriam as he whispers. As Sam pivots back to the attic and enters, closing the gate, he monitors closely at the gate to Miriam's movements crossing the kitchen, the swish of the gate sliding, followed by stillness, and then a racket of boisterous female giggling as Lester giggles with delight. Sam chuckles softly and then peers at Miriam, while Lester praises the kitten, and Miriam and Sam glance at each other awkwardly. Miriam clears her voice while Lester gawks at the balloons and streamers, reciting aloud, as Miriam and Sam retort together.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Nathan is browsing lingerie ads when Florence enters. He hands her the baby and Dr. Spock's book as he drives off, and Ed starts crying. A room with streamers is revealed as Ed and Nathan Jr. enter; Ed points out places of interest to the goggle-eyed baby. Impatient, he props Nathan Jr. on the couch. Hi beams at Nathan Jr., who looks at Hi and Ed expectantly. Hi slaps his knee as Ed grabs a Polaroid. She and Hi prepare for a photo, smiling at the camera. Meanwhile, Gale and Evelle hastily fill and leave in a Mercury at a gas station. Hi later awakens to loud knocking at the door. Ed listens as Hi answers, greeted by Gale's laughter. She smiles politely as Gale admires the baby. Hi and Ed exchange uncomfortable glances while Gale reads the decorations aloud.
